p: Blood sample collection, blood cell separation, blood cell preservation, and serum preservation followed previous study [ 21]. After standard diagnostic tests, all anticoagulated venous blood samples treated with ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid disodium salt (EDTA-2Na) were separated by centrifugation at 3000 rpm, then rested at room temperature for 7 min. Whole blood cells were storage at − 80 °C. Before stored at − 80 °C, 200-μL aliquot of serum mixing with 800 μL of ice-cold methanol and a 200-μL aliquot of serum mixing with 800 μL of ice-cold isopropanol were prepared.
